Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
Portfolio
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Portfolio extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an investment portfolio containing various assets. Implements Serializable to support object serialization for persistence. Each portfolio is associated with an investor and maintains a list of assets.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Portfolio

      public Portfolio(Investor createdBy, PortfolioDatabase portfolioDatabase, String name)
      Constructs a new Portfolio with the specified owner, database reference, and name. Automatically adds the new portfolio to the database.
      Parameters:
      createdBy - The investor who owns this portfolio
      portfolioDatabase - The database where the portfolio will be stored
      name - The name of the portfolio

  • Method Details

    • getOwner

      public Investor getOwner()
      Gets the owner of this portfolio.
      Returns:
      The Investor who owns this portfolio

    • getAssets

      public List<Asset> getAssets()
      Gets the list of assets in this portfolio.
      Returns:
      A List of Asset objects in the portfolio

    • addAsset

      public boolean addAsset()
      Adds a new asset to the portfolio using the AssetFactory. Updates the portfolio in the database after successful addition.
      Returns:
      true if the asset was added successfully, false otherwise

    • removeAsset

      public Boolean removeAsset(Asset asset)
      Removes an asset from the portfolio. Updates the portfolio in the database after successful removal.
      Parameters:
      asset - The asset to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the asset was removed successfully, false otherwise

    • editAsset

      public boolean editAsset(String Name)
      Edits an existing asset in the portfolio by name. Updates the portfolio in the database after successful edit.
      Parameters:
      Name - The name of the asset to edit
      Returns:
      true if the asset was edited successfully, false otherwise

    • viewAssets

      public void viewAssets()
      Displays all assets in the portfolio to the console. Shows a message if the portfolio is empty.

    • getAssetByName

      public Asset getAssetByName(String name)
      Retrieves an asset from the portfolio by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the asset to find
      Returns:
      The Asset object if found, null otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the portfolio.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string containing the portfolio name
